snippet: At a news conference in Tunis, Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan refused to yield to the demands of protesters in dozens of Turkish cities.
abstract: Turkish Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan returns to his country and is met at airport by tens of thousands of supporters who offer a boisterous counterpoint to demonstrations that have occupied central Istanbul; show of support has air of a political rally and serves as reminder to  supporters and opponents alike that Erdogan is still vastly popular leader among many Turks.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and SEBNEM ARSU

lead_paragraph: At a news conference in Tunis, Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan refused to yield to the demands of protesters in dozens of Turkish cities.

headline.seo: Turkish Leader Says Razing of Park to Proceed
headline.main: Turkish Leader Says Razing of Istanbul Park Will Proceed
headline.print_headline: Turkish Leader Says Razing of Park Will Proceed Despite Protests
